p: Social network analysis (SNA) is one exception to the previous statement. This approach may include geographically explicit data, as well as temporal data. It determines the location of individuals (‘nodes’) and the time and duration of contacts [26]. SNA has demonstrated that temporal structures may influence epidemics in several ways [27]. SNA has been reported to: 1) risk missing data on connections [27], and 2) be sensitive to dynamic changes [28].
